availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mordecai P. Hunnicut (Morgan County, OH, plasterer and serg. 73rd OVI.)

body.p: Morgan County, Ohio, plasterer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Martha Hunnicut. Father of Isabella Hunnicut and William Hunnicut. Plasterer in Morgan County, Ohio, in 1850. Plasterer in Chesterfield in 1860. Served in the 73rd Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and sergeant from November 19, 1862, to September 9, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Morgan County, Morgan, p. 238B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Morgan County, Chesterfield, p. 440.
Eleventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1890), Veteran Schedules, Texas, McLennan County, Waco.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Ohio, Application #1021729.
